newsitem.title: POLAND: EBRD to lend Poland 50 mln Ecus for railways.
newsitem.headline: EBRD to lend Poland 50 mln Ecus for railways.

text.p: Poland agreed with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) to guarantee the bank's 50 million Ecu loan for a major railway project, the finance ministry said on Wednesday.
"The Polish government and the EBRD signed an guarantee agreement in London concerning a loan for the State Railways," it said in a statement.
The EBRD loan will help finance a 487 million Ecu programme to modernise a 479 km railway route between Warsaw and the town of Kunowice, near the Polish-German border.
The line is to become part of a trans-European route linking Paris, Berlin, Warsaw and Moscow.
The European Investment Bank (EIB) will lend 200 million Ecu for the scheme and the European Union will contribute 30 million Ecu through its PHARE aid programme.
Polish State Railways will cover the remaining costs.
